1$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$3/7/2014 7:38:55 PM$Reviewer: Zoey Cooley, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$1$I am 15 years and am being treated for depression, along with bipolar disorder. I have been taking this medication for 2 days, and within the first few hours of taking it I was extremely restless and had only gotten about 3 hours of very interrupted sleep. The next morning I was very nauseous and vomited once, and for the rest of the day I felt nauseous. Last night I got a decent amount of sleep but woke up every hour on the hour. There is a constant feeling of nausea on this medication. I also found myself a bit drool-y. Today, unaware of the effects, I drank a Monster Energy drink. Big mistake. I currently feel very shaky, dilated pupils, a general haziness, very cold and blurred vision. I won't be sleeping tonight I'm sure. Essentially, I got every side effect this medication can offer and plan to stop taking it tonight.
2$Condition: Agitation associated with Bipolar Mania$5/11/2013 9:10:40 AM$Reviewer: $1$1$1$Abilify gave me hallucinations and delusions on the second day when I NEVER had them before. When I complained to my doctor and insisted I would not take it
column2: he threw a fit! Then I learned Medicare pays $683 to the drug-maker for this poison. Apparently
column3: my doctor needed me on this drug to pay for the mags on his Porsche. Do NOT take this poison!"

column1: 4$Condition: Other$6/23/2012 8:53:04 PM$Reviewer: ocdgirl
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$4$5$I have severe obsessive compulsive disorder. I had been on Lexapro
column3: AND I was doing well after 2 years I went off it. I was doing well for a few months
column4: and then my OCD spiraled out of control. I started taking Lexapro again 3 weeks ago. Last week I was still doing horribly. My Psychiatrist put me on 2 MG of Abilify and it seemed to kick in for me the next day. I'm not perfect
column5: but my OCD thoughts are much less. I'm not ruminating. I don't have rituals
column6: just obsessive thoughts. They're practically gone in one week. This medicine seems to have done the trick for me thus far. I have just started CBT therapy too. My appetite has increased. I don't know if it's actually from the Abilify.

column1: 21$Condition: Mania associated with Bipolar Disorder$11/23/2007 9:06:21 AM$Reviewer: Physcho
